alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Dauphin; Northumberland; Schuylkill; Snyder (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:40PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN SCHUYLKILL... SOUTHERN NORTHUMBERLAND...NORTHEASTERN DAUPHIN...SOUTHEASTERN SNYDER AND SOUTH CENTRAL COLUMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 340 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Selinsgrove, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shamokin, Mount Carmel, Kulpmont, Ashland, Fairview-Ferndale, Trevorton, Tremont, Marshallton, Port Trevorton, Lavelle, Donaldson, Wilburton Number One, Locustdale, Klingerstown, Beurys Lake, Wilburton Number Two, Leck Kill, Urban, Rebuck and Edgewood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central and central Pennsylvania.
